PREFACE 
    This Code constitutes a republication of the ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, Florida of a general and permanent nature. 
    Source materials used in the preparation of the Code were the 1957 Code, as republished in 2008, and ordinances subsequently adopted by the City Council. The source of each section is included in the history note appearing in parentheses at the end thereof. The absence of such a note indicates that the section is new and was adopted for the first time with the adoption of the Code. By use of the comparative tables appearing in the back of this volume, the reader can locate any section of the 1957 Code, and any subsequent ordinance included herein. 
    The chapters of the Code have been arranged in the order requested by the City Council and the various sections within each chapter have been catchlined to facilitate usage. Footnotes which tie related sections of the Code together and which refer to relevant state laws have been included. 
Numbering System 
    The numbering system used in this Code is the same system used in many state and municipal codes. Each section number consists of two component parts separated by a dash, the figure before the dash referring to the chapter number and the figure after the dash referring to the position of the section within the chapter. Thus, the first section of Chapter 1 is numbered 1-1 and the fifteenth section of Chapter 6 is 6-15. Under this system, each section is identified with its chapter and at the same time new sections or even whole chapters can be inserted in their proper place simply by using the decimal system for amendments. By way of illustration: If new material consisting of three sections that would logically come between sections 10-10 and 10-11 is desired to be added, such new sections would be numbered 10-10.1, 10-10.2 and 10-10.3, respectively. New chapters may be included in the same manner. If the new material is to be included between Chapters 12 and 13, it will be designated as Chapter 12.5. Care should be taken that the alphabetical arrangement of chapters is maintained when including new chapters. New articles and new divisions may be included in the same way or, in the case of articles, may be placed at the end of the chapter embracing the subject, and, in the case of divisions, may be placed at the end of the article embracing the subject, the next successive number being assigned to the article or division. 
Indices 
    The indices have been prepared with the greatest of care. Each particular item has been placed under several headings, some of the headings being couched in lay phraseology, others in legal terminology, and still others in language generally used by municipal officials and employees. There are numerous cross references within each index which stand as guideposts to direct the user to the particular item in which he is interested. 
Looseleaf Supplements 
    A special feature of this Code to which the attention of the user is especially directed is the looseleaf system of binding and supplemental servicing for the Code. With this system, the Code will be kept up-to-date periodically. Upon the final passage of amendatory ordinances, they will be properly edited and the appropriate page or pages affected will be reprinted. These new pages will be distributed to holders of copies of the Code, with instructions for the manner of inserting the new pages and deleting the obsolete pages. 
    Successfully keeping this Code up-to-date at all times will depend largely upon the holder of the volume. As revised sheets are received, it will then become the responsibility of the holder to have the amendments inserted according to the attached instructions. It is strongly recommended by the publisher that all such amendments be inserted immediately upon receipt to avoid misplacing them and, in addition, that all deleted pages be saved and filed for historical reference purposes. 
Acknowledgments 
    The publication of this Code was under the direct supervision of Kelly Heaton-Moniz, Editor, and Janet Cramer, Proofreader, of the Municipal Code Corporation, Tallahassee, Florida. Credit is gratefully given to the other members of the publisher's staff for their sincere interest and able assistance throughout the project. 
    The publisher is most grateful to Ms. Pamela Latimore, City Clerk, and the other members of the City staff for their cooperation and assistance during the progress of the work on this publication. It is hoped that their efforts and those of the publisher have resulted in a Code of Ordinances which will make the active law of the City readily accessible to all citizens and which will be a valuable tool in the day-to-day administration of the City's affairs. 
MUNICIPAL CODE CORPORATION Tallahassee, Florida  
ENABLING ORDINANCE NO. 2008-6 
AN ORDINANCE REENACTING THE CODE OF ORDINANCES OF THE CITY OF NORTH MIAMI BEACH, FLORIDA, PROVIDING FOR THE REPEAL OF CERTAIN ORDINANCES NOT INCLUDED THEREIN, AND THE SAVING FROM REPEAL OF CERTAIN OTHER ORDINANCES NOT INCLUDED THEREIN; PROVIDING FOR RECODIFICATION; AUTHORIZING CERTAIN MODIFICATIONS TO CODE; PROVIDING SEVERABILITY; PROVIDING AN EFFECTIVE DATE. 
    WHEREAS, the City Council of the City of North Miami Beach in Miami-Dade County, Florida, has caused its ordinances of a general and permanent nature to be compiled and revised and embodied in a revision and re-codification known as the "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, 2008." 
    NOW, THEREFORE, 
BE IT ORDAINED by the City Council of the City of North Miami Beach, Florida, that: 
    Section 1. The accompanying revision and re-codification of the Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, Florida, of a general and permanent nature, as re-codified in the following chapters, namely Chapter 1 to Chapter XXVI, is hereby adopted and enacted as the official "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, Florida, 2008." 
    Section 2. All of the provisions of the "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, 2008," shall be in force and effect on and after the effective date of this ordinance and shall supersede all ordinances of a general and permanent nature enacted by the City prior to January 1, 2008. 
    Section 3. All ordinances of a general and permanent nature, adopted by the Governing Body of the City of North Miami Beach and in force on January 1, 2008, and not contained in the "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, 2008," are hereby repealed from and after the effective date of this ordinance, except as hereinafter provided in Section 4. 
    Section 4. The repeal provided for in Section 3 of this ordinance shall not affect: 
a.  Any offenses or act committed or done or any penalty or forfeiture incurred or any contract or right established or accruing before the effective date of this ordinance; 
b.  Any prosecution, action, suit or other proceeding pending or any judgment rendered on or prior to the effective date of this ordinance; 
c.  Any right or franchise conferred by the Governing Body of the City of North Miami Beach; 
d.  Any right, public right, right-of-way or easement acquired, established, vacated, released or extinguished in, upon, under or over any street, avenue, road, highway, park, public square or other public place within the City of North Miami Beach or any portion thereof; 
e.  Any ordinance providing for designating or laying out or establishing or opening or altering or widening or extending or relocating or straightening or establishing grade or naming or changing name or improvement or acceptance or dedicating or releasing the dedication or vacation of any street, avenue, road, highway, park, memorial area, public square or other public place within the City of North Miami Beach, or any portion thereof; 
f.  Any ordinance or resolution borrowing money or promising or guaranteeing the payment of money by or for the City of North Miami Beach or authorizing the issuing of bonds or other evidence of the City's indebtedness; 
g.  The annual budget appropriation ordinances or resolutions, and all ordinances and resolutions appropriating money or transferring funds; 
h.  Any ordinance acquiring or authorizing acquisition of lands or premises or easements or rights-of-way for municipal or public use; 
i.  Any ordinance authorizing or providing for the sale or lease of lands or premises owned by the City of North Miami Beach; 
j.  Any ordinance providing for or authorizing municipal, public, general or local improvements; 
k.  Any ordinance or resolution prescribing the form of contract or contracts or authorizing the City of North Miami Beach to enter into, execute or assume a contract or contracts; 
l.  Any ordinance or resolution authorizing the foreclosure of tax liens or certificates held by the City of North Miami Beach; 
m.  Any ordinance providing for the payment of a pension or fixing salaries of municipal employees who have retired on pensions; 
n.  Any ordinance adopting or approving urban renewal plans or redevelopment plans or projects or establishing or approving the name or location of urban renewal projects or authorizing the application for funds in connection therewith; 
o.  Any ordinance in force and effect on January 1, 2008, fixing the compensation or salaries of the elected officials and/or all other officers and employees of the City of North Miami Beach or the pay or rate of pay and compensation of positions and employments or the salary ranges or salary increments, compensation time, or additional compensation or salary with respect thereto, or other benefits and allowances including, but not by way of limitation, clothing, uniform or equipment allowances or special assignment allowances; 
p.  Any ordinance in force and effect on January 1, 2008, creating employments or positions or offices or fixing the number thereof or fixing or changing or deleting titles thereof or fixing duties and qualifications therefor which are not provided for in the "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, Florida, 2008"; 
q.  Any ordinance in force and effect on January 1, 2008 creating and establishing offices or employments or positions or titles within the classified services of the Civil Service or which are held by any officer or employee of the City of North Miami Beach; 
r.  Any ordinances creating and establishing pensions for employees of the City; 
s.  Any ordinances of the City Council adopted upon final passage after the first day of January, 2008; 
t.  Any ordinance or resolution in effect on January 1, 2008, which clearly by its import and/or content were omitted from this list by error. 
    Section 5. Certain chapters and sections of the Code of ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, 1957, have been repealed by omission from the new Code and are specifically repealed by this Enabling Ordinance. 
    Many individual sections have not been continued in the new Code if they have been superseded by newer, more restrictive State Statutes or ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach. The Code Comparative Table which is printed in the Appendix of the Code may be helpful in locating topics in the 2008 Code. 
Section 6. The text of the 1957 Code has been substantially revised, edited, amended, supplemented and rearranged to establish the "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, 2008." The effects of proposed changes contained in the revision are listed below: 
    Throughout the Code many revisions, deletions and corrections have been required to comply with current State Statutes, Codes and Regulations enacted and/or enforced by the State of Florida, Miami-Dade County and the City of North Miami Beach. In some chapters de minimus revisions have been made for clarity of interpretation. 
    In order to comply with the Florida Statute requiring the revision of the term "license" or "occupation license," these terms have been revised to "business tax," "business tax receipt" or "holder of a business tax receipt" as required by the text. 
    The following revisions were made throughout the Code as adopted by Ord. No. 2006-1 § 2: "South Florida Building Code" has been replaced by "Florida Building Code"; 
    "Department of Health and Rehabilitation Services" and "Department of Health and Rehabilitative Services" have been replaced by "Florida Department of Children and Families," The letters "HRS" have been replaced by the letters "DCF"; 
    "Department of Natural Resources" has been replaced by the words "Department of Environmental Protection." The letters "DNR" have been replaced by the letters "DEP"; 
    "Oleta River State Recreation Area" and "Oleta River State Recreational Area" have been replaced by "Oleta River State Park"; 
    "Dade County," "Metro-Dade County" and "Metropolitan Dade County" have been replaced by the words "Miami-Dade County." 
    References to "Municipal Court" or "Municipal Judge" have been revised to "appropriate tribunal," as the City no longer has a Municipal Court. 
CHAPTER I. General Provisions of the Code contains the general provisions, applicable to the entire Code and the continuation of many sections of Chapter I of the 1957 Code. 
CHAPTER II: Structure of City Government. 
    Many provisions of Chapter 2 of the 1957 Code are continued in Chapter II of the 2008 Code. 
    This chapter has been divided into Articles to make it convenient to use by City Officials and the residents of the City as follows: 
Article I The City Council; Article II The City Attorney; Article III Office of the City Clerk; Article IV City Manager; Article V Department of the City Government; Article VI Civil Defense Organization and County Mutual Aid Plan; Article VII Boards, Committees and Commissions; Article VIII Reserved; Article IX Administrative Procedures and Policies.  
CHAPTER III: Purchasing. 
    This chapter contains a continuation of provisions of Chapter 2B of the 1957 Code as amended by more recently-adopted ordinances. 
CHAPTER IV: Recreation. 
    This chapter contains the regulations established for the various recreation programs in the City of North Miami Beach, as well as the requirement that in certain conditions, developers are required to provide land for recreation areas. 
CHAPTER V: Human Resources. 
    The ordinances that provide the guidelines and regulations for the employees of the City of North Miami Beach, including residing requirements, Civil Service and the creation of the Civil Service Board, the procedures for employment, disciplinary action, the prohibition of political discrimination or favoritism, the prohibition of employees in the classified service from taking part in a political campaign and provisions for sick leave and vacation are codified in this chapter. Section 5-4, Pensions, states that the City shall provide pension and retirement benefits for City employees who are entitled by Contract, Agreement or Civil Service Regulations. 
CHAPTER VI: Animals and Fowl. 
    Chapter VI, Animals and Fowl is a continuation of many provisions of Chapter 5 of the 1957 Code. 
    In this chapter references to local animal control regulations have been changed to refer to the "Miami-Dade County Animal Control" as the County provides these services. 
    The definition of "owner" in subsection 6-5.1 has been revised to include "feeding" of any animal within the territorial limits of the City. 
    Subsection 6-5.3, Vaccinations Required, subsection 6-5.4, Harboring Unnoculated or Unlicensed Dogs, and subsection 6-6.1, Leashing, Proximity to Owner is Required; Females in Heat, have been revised to include "and any other vaccinations required by Miami-Dade County Animal Control." 
    Subsection 6-6.1, Leashing, Proximity to Owner is Required; Females in Heat, has been revised as follows..." the owner or responsible person shall be within twenty (20) feet from the animal at all times." 
CHAPTER VII: Elections. 
    Regulations that were contained in Chapter 7 and Chapter 2 of the 1957 Code, as amended by more recently adopted ordinances concerning the elective process, are continued in this chapter. 
    Section 7-14, Early Voting, has been revised to add the following: "For each election period the Mayor and City Council, upon the advice of the City Clerk, as election supervisor, shall designate Early Voting Dates." 
CHAPTER VIII: Taxation. 
    The pertinent provisions of the 1957 Code concerning taxes on real and personal property, the exemption for a widow with a child or children, the exemption for blind veterans, the homestead exemption for senior citizens and the requirements of the Municipal Utility Excise tax are contained in this chapter. 
CHAPTER IX: Offenses and Miscellaneous Provisions. 
    This chapter is a continuation of the pertinent provisions of Chapter 13 of the 1957 Code, as further amended and supplemented. 
CHAPTER X: Traffic. 
    This traffic chapter is a continuation of Chapter 21 of the 1957 Code, as amended and supplemented by ordinances of the City Council. 
CHAPTER XI: Reserved. 
CHAPTER XII: Local Business Tax Receipts and Regulations. 
    This chapter codifies the requirements to obtain a local business tax receipt and the fees are established. 
    The following chapters or portions thereof of the 1957 Code have been included in Chapter XII, Local Business Tax Receipts and Regulations if they are currently enforced and as amended by ordinance: 
Chapter 3, Advertising and Sales; 
Chapter 4, Alcoholic Beverages; 
Chapter 12, Licenses; 
Chapter 13, Offenders and Miscellaneous Provisions; 
Chapter 14, Peddlers and Solicitors; 
Chapter 15, Places of Public Assemblage; 
Chapter 16, Private Schools, Nurseries and Montessori Schools; 
Chapter 20A, Towing. 
    Article V, Local Business Tax Fees, contains Section 12-31, Schedule of Fees for Business Tax Receipts. 
    This chapter contains many revisions to comply with the Florida Statute that changes "license" or "occupational license" to "business tax receipt," but these changes are de minimus as they do not change the intent of the ordinance that has been adopted. 
CHAPTER XIII: Adult Entertainment Code. 
    The chapter contains the Adult Entertainment Code and the licensing requirements to obtain an adult entertainment license. 
CHAPTER XIV: Building and Housing. 
    This chapter contains the adoption by reference of the Building Code, creates the Office of the Chief Building Official, structure-moving regulations, regulating the construction of swimming pools, house trailers, auxiliary buildings, houseboats and tents, boiler inspections, requires sewer connections, the administration and enforcement of building, planning and zoning regulations, the construction of sea walls and bulkheads and residential rental permits and inspections. Many of these sections are a continuation of Chapter 6 of the 1957 Code. 
CHAPTER XV: Fire Prevention. 
    This chapter is a continuation of Chapter 9 of the 1957 Code. Reference to the "Fire Prevention Code" has been changed to "Life Safety Code, 2006." Enforcement of these provisions is the responsibility of the Fire Department of Miami-Dade County. 
CHAPTER XVI: Property Maintenance. 
    This chapter is a continuation of the provisions of Chapter 6 from the 1957 Code. 
CHAPTER XVII: Streets and Sidewalks. 
    Chapter XVII is a continuation of Chapter 19 of the 1957 Code and includes permit to convey garbage over streets; cutting or tunneling under streets; street construction; construction of roads in new subdivision; sidewalk construction and discharge of pollutants, sediments and erosion from land disturbing activities. 
    This chapter has been revised to provide that the Chief Building Official shall issue permits. Many references to "approval for authority of the City Council" have been revised to "approval by or authority of the City Engineer." 
    In subsection 17-2.6 Repair Specifications, specifications for the repair of the street, alley or sidewalk have been revised. Subsection 17-2.7, Open Evacuations, has been revised to require barricades and nighttime warning lights and requires that maintenance of traffic plans be submitted to the City Engineer. 
    In many instances the term "consulting engineer" has been replaced with the term "Engineer of Record," 
    Subsection 17-3.4, Permits and Re-Inspection, has been revised to increase the permit fees and to establish a minimum permit fee. 
    Subsection 17-3.5, Road Designations; Width, Base Materials, and subsection 17-3.6, Street and Sidewalk Construction... have been revised to require that all municipal roads shall follow the designations of Miami-Dade County, and shall comply with the details and specifications of the Miami-Dade County Public Works Manual. 
    Subsection 17-4.10, Specifications for Resurfacing Street Where Cutting and Ditching Occurred has been revised to provide two options for resurfacing streets. 
    Subsection 17-4.11, Plans, Drawings, Permits and Documents to Accompany Application to be Approved requires that all blueprints and drawings for curbing, landscaping and storm water drainage systems, etc. shall include drawings presented with the permit application. This subsection also requires that the package includes permits and documents as required by the City, which shall be the original, signed copies. 
    In subsection 17-5.5, Concrete, the standard specifications have been revised. 
    Section 17-6 prohibits the discharge of illegal substances into watercourse from construction activities. 
CHAPTER XVIII: Solid Waste Management. 
    This chapter continues the provisions of Chapter 10 of the 1957 Code. 
CHAPTER XIX: Water and Sewers. 
    This Water and Sewers chapter is derived from Chapter 23 of the 1957 Code. The references to the City Water Board and the Public Services Commission have been revised to refer to the Public Services Department of the City. 
CHAPTER XX: Stormwater. 
    Stormwater management regulations, which were adopted by Ordinance No. 92-12 are complete in this chapter. 
CHAPTER XXI: Health. 
    The health regulations contained in this chapter are a continuation of provisions from Chapter 11 of the 1957 Code. 
    Section 21-4. Kosher Foods, has been added to include a reference to Article XIA of the Miami-Dade County Code. 
CHAPTER XXII: Cable Television. 
    This chapter codifies the requirements to provide a Cable Television System to the City of North Miami Beach. 
CHAPTER XXIII: Risk Management 
    The General Liability Risk Management Program of, the City of North Miami Beach is contained in this chapter. Settlement limits without City Council approval have been adjusted to meet current standards. 
CHAPTER XXIV: Zoning and Land Development Code. 
    The Zoning and Land Development Code is complete in this chapter. Any revisions that have been made have been considered de minimus, as they have been made to concur with the comprehensive Land Development Plan-Land Use Element or County or State Codes or Standards. 
CHAPTER XXV: Reserved. 
CHAPTER XXVI: Telecommunications. 
    This chapter contains the regulations to permit a Service Provider to construct and maintain telecommunications facilities and to provide compensation for the City. 
    Section 7. Where conflicts in language by error or omission are found between provisions of the Code as originally enacted and as recodified, the City is authorized to administratively amend such conflicts, if clearly caused by omissions or errors, to conform the new recodified Code with the original Code. 
    Section 8. A copy of the "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach in the County of Miami-Dade and State of Florida, 2008" in loose-leaf form, has been filed in the office of the City Clerk of the City of North Miami Beach and shall remain there for the use and examination of the public until final action is taken on this ordinance, and if this ordinance shall be adopted, such copy shall be certified to by the City Clerk by impressing thereon the seal of the City of North Miami Beach, as provided by law, and such certified copy shall remain on file in the office of the City Clerk of the City of North Miami Beach to be made available to persons desiring to examine the same during all times while the Code is in effect. 
    Section 9. Amendments to the Code of Ordinances. Any and all additions, amendments and supplements to the Code when passed and adopted in such form as to indicate the intent of the City Council to make them a part thereof shall be deemed to be incorporated therein so that reference to the "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, 2008" shall be understood and intended to include such additions, amendments and supplements. Whenever such additions, amendments and supplements to the Code shall be adopted, they shall thereafter be printed (as provided, in this ordinance) and inserted in the book containing the "Code of Ordinances" as amended and supplemented. 
    Section 10. It shall be the duty of the City Clerk or someone authorized and directed by the Clerk to keep up-to-date the certified copy of the book containing the "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, 2008" required to be filed in his or her office for the use of the public. All changes in the Code and all ordinances adopted specifically as part of the Code shall, when finally adopted, be included herein by reference until such changes or new ordinances are printed as supplements to the Code, at which time such supplements shall be inserted. 
    Section 11. The City Clerk of the City of North Miami Beach, pursuant to law, shall cause to be published, in the manner required, a copy of this enabling ordinance or summary thereof, in a newspaper of general circulation in the City of North Miami Beach. Sufficient copies of the "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, 2008" shall be maintained in the office of the City Clerk for inspection by the public at all times during regular office hours, The enactment and publication of this ordinance or summary thereof, coupled with availability of copies of the Code for inspection by the public, shall be deemed, held and considered to be due and legal publication of all provisions of the Code for all purposes. 
    Section 12. Each section of the "Code of Ordinances of the City of North Miami Beach, 2008" and every part of each section is an independent section or part of a section and the holding of any section or part thereof to be unconstitutional, void or ineffective for any cause shall not be deemed to effect the validity or constitutionality of any other sections or parts thereof. 
    Section 13. This ordinance shall take effect immediately upon final passage and publication thereof according to law.

    The table below allows users of this Code to quickly and accurately determine what ordinances have been considered for codification in each supplement. Ordinances that are of a general and permanent nature are codified in the Code Book and are considered "Includes." Ordinances that are not of a general and permanent nature are not codified in the Code Book and are considered "Omits." 
    In addition, by adding to this table with each supplement, users of this Code of Ordinances will be able to gain a more complete picture of the Code's historical evolution.

PART I - CHARTER[1] 
CITY OF NORTH MIAMI BEACH 
Preamble. 
    We, the people of the City of North Miami Beach, in order to secure for ourselves the benefits and responsibilities of home rule and in order to provide for a municipal government to serve our present and future needs, do hereby adopt this charter and as part thereof adopt the following Citizens' Bill of Rights. 
Citizens' Bill of Rights. 
A)  This government has been created to protect the governed, not the governing. In order to provide the public with full and accurate information, to promote efficient administrative management, to make government more accountable, and to insure to all persons fair and equitable treatment, the following rights are guaranteed: 
1.  Convenient access. Every person has the right to transact business with the City with a minimum of personal inconvenience. It shall be the duty of the City Manager and the City Commission to provide, within the City's budget limitations, reasonable convenient times and places for required inspections, and for transacting business with the City. 
2.  Truth in government. No municipal official or employee shall knowingly furnish false information on any public matter, nor knowingly omit significant facts when giving requested information to members of the public. 
3.  Public records. All audits, reports, minutes, documents and other public records of the City and its boards, agencies, departments and authorities shall be open for inspection at reasonable time and places convenient to the public. 
4.  Minutes and ordinance register. The City Clerk shall maintain and make available for public inspection an ordinance register separate from the minutes showing the votes of each member on all ordinances (Ordinance means an official legislative action of the North Miami Beach Commission, which action is a regulation of a general and permanent nature and enforceable as a local law), and resolutions (Resolution means an expression of the North Miami Beach Commission concerning matters of administration, an expression of a temporary character, or a provision for the disposition of a particular item of the administrative business of the North Miami Beach Commission) listed by descriptive title. Written minutes of all meetings and the ordinance register shall be available for public inspection not later than thirty (30) days after the conclusion of the meeting, 
5.  Right to be heard. So far as the orderly conduct of public business permits, any interested person has the right to appear before the City Commission or any City agency, board or department for the presentation, adjustment or determination of an issue, request or controversy within the jurisdiction of the City. Matters shall be scheduled for the convenience of the public, and the agenda shall be divided into approximate time periods so that the public may know approximately when a matter will be heard. Nothing herein shall prohibit the City or any agency thereof from imposing reasonable time limits for the presentation of a matter. 
6.  Right to Notice. Persons entitled to notice of a City hearing shall be timely informed as to the time, place and nature of the hearing and the legal authority pursuant to which the hearing is to be held. Failure by an individual to receive such notice shall not constitute mandatory grounds for canceling the hearing or rendering invalid any determination made at such hearing. Copies of proposed ordinances or resolutions shall be made available at a reasonable time prior to the hearing, unless the matter involves an emergency ordinance or resolution. 
7.  No unreasonable postponements. No matter once having been placed on a formal agenda by the City shall be postponed to another day except for good cause shown in the opinion of the City Commission, or agency conducting such meeting, and then only on condition that any person so requesting is mailed adequate notice of the new date of any postponed meeting. Failure by an individual to receive such notice shall not constitute mandatory grounds for canceling the hearing or rendering invalid any determination made at such hearing. 
8.  Right to public hearing. Upon a timely request of any interested party a public hearing shall be held by any City agency, board, department or authority upon any significant policy decision to be issued by it, which is not subject to subsequent administrative or legislative review and hearing. This provision shall not apply to the law department of the City or to anybody whose duties and responsibilities are solely advisory. At any zoning or other hearing in which review is exclusively by certiorari, a party or his counsel shall be entitled to present his case or defense by oral or documentary evidence, to submit rebuttal evidence, and to conduct such cross-examination as may be required for a full and true disclosure of the facts. The decision of any such agency, board, department or authority must be based upon the facts in the record. Procedural rules establishing reasonable time and other limitations may be promulgated and amended from time to time. 
9.  Notice of action and reasons. Prompt notice shall be given of the denial in whole or in part of a request of an interested person made in connection with any municipal administrative decision or proceeding when the decision is reserved at the conclusion of the hearing. The notice shall be accompanied by a statement of the grounds for denial. 
10.  Manager's and Attorneys' reports. The City Manager and City Attorney shall periodically make a public status report on all major matters pending or concluded within their respective jurisdictions. 
11.  Budgeting. In addition to any budget required by state statute, the City Manager shall prepare a budget showing the cost of each department for each budget year. Prior to the City Commission's first public hearing on the proposed budget required by state law, the City Manager shall make public a budget summary setting forth the proposed cost of each individual department and reflecting the personnel for each department, the purposes therefor, the estimated millage cost of each department and the amount of any contingency and carryover funds for each department. 
12.  Quarterly budget comparisons. The City Manager shall make public a quarterly report showing the actual expenditures during the quarter just ended against one-quarter of the proposed annual expenditures set forth in the budget. Such report shall also reflect the same cumulative information for whatever portion of the fiscal year that has elapsed. 
13.  Adequate audits. An annual audit of the City shall be made by an independent certified public accounting firm in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards. The independent City Auditor shall be appointed by the City Commission; both appointment and removal of the independent City Auditor shall be made by the City Commission. A summary of the results of the independent City Auditor's annual audit, including any deficiencies found, shall be made public. In making such audit, proprietary functions shall be audited separately and adequate depreciation on proprietary facilities shall be accrued so the public may determine the amount of any direct or indirect subsidy. Duties, method of selection, and method of compensation of the independent City Auditor shall be established by ordinance. 
14.  Representation of public. The City Commission shall endeavor to provide representation at all proceedings significantly affecting the City and its residents before state and federal regulatory bodies. 
15.  Natural resources and scenic beauty. It shall be the policy of the City of North Miami Beach to conserve and protect its natural resources and scenic beauty. 
B)  The foregoing enumeration of citizens' rights vests large and pervasive powers in the citizenry of the City of North Miami Beach. Such power necessarily carries with it responsibility of equal magnitude for the successful operation of government in the City. The orderly, efficient and fair operation of government requires the knowledgeable participation of individual citizens exercising their rights with dignity and restraint so as to avoid any sweeping acceleration in the cost of government because of the exercise of individual prerogatives, and for individual citizens to grant respect for the dignity of public office. 
C)  Remedies for violations. In any suit by a citizen alleging a violation of this Bill of Rights filed in the Miami-Dade County circuit court pursuant to its general equity jurisdiction, the plaintiff, if successful, shall be entitled to recover costs as fixed by the court. Any public official or employee who is found by the court to have willfully violated this article shall forthwith forfeit his office or employment. 
D)  Construction. All provisions of this article shall be construed to be supplementary to and not in conflict with the general laws of Florida. If any part of this article shall be declared invalid, it shall not affect the validity of the remaining provisions.

Article I. - Creation, Form of Government, Incorporation and Boundaries, Powers, and Oath of Office 

Sec. 1.1 - Creation. 
    There is hereby created a municipality to be known as the City of North Miami Beach, the inhabitants of which shall be and constitute a body corporate and politic, with perpetual existence as a City under the laws of the State of Florida, the territorial limits of which shall be as set forth in section 1.3 hereof, as the same may be amended from time to time under the provisions of the Constitution and Laws of the State of Florida. 
Sec. 1.2 - Form of government. 
    The form of government of the City of North Miami Beach shall be that of commission-manager, the powers of which City shall be exercised by a City Commission and a City Manager, and other officers, as hereinafter set forth. 
Sec. 1.3 - Boundaries.
